thread.title: Blast in DHA Lahore claims seven lives
thread.title_full: Blast in DHA Lahore claims seven lives

title: Blast in DHA Lahore claims seven lives
text:
Blast in DHA Lahore claims seven lives | Police officials among 14 martyred in Lahore suicide bombing 
LAHORE: An explosion in Lahore's DHA Y-Block has claimed seven lives while 17 people have been injured, rescue sources informed Geo News. 
However speaking to the media, Punjab Health Minister Salman Rafiq claimed 4 people had been killed, 4 were critically and doctors were fighting to save their lives while another 15 injured were under treatment at the General Hospital. 
After some conflicting reports, the Punjab Police confirmed the explosion to have been caused by a timed device. 
Panic gripped the area a little before noon when a loud explosion resonated across Y-Block in DHA Lahore. The area is a popular shopping centre in the DHA locality of the city. 
Reports state that the explosion took place in an under construction building. Four cars and 12 motorcycles were also damaged as a result of the blast while the windows of nearby buildings were shattered. 
Emergency was declared at the General Hospital following the explosion where the injured are being rushed for treatment. 
According to Punjab Police the explosion was caused by a timed device which contained 8-10 kilograms of explosives. 
However, earlier the official Punjab government twitter account stated the explosion was the result of a generator explosion. Clarification on Lahore Y block blast: It's a generator blast and rescue team has reached the site. Please spread this. â€” Govt Of The Punjab (@GovtOfPunjab) February 23, 2017 
Earlier on 13 February, at least 14 people including two senior police officials were killed in a suicide bombing near the Punjab Assembly.
